Trump also criticised the "radical left," claiming their rhetoric fueled the tragedy and urged Americans to uphold values like free speech and the rule of law in Kirk's memory.

title: Punjab: AAP MLA Manjinder Lalpura & 6 cops among 11 found guilty of molestation

A Tarn Taran court will pronounce the sentence Friday. The survivor expressed relief, stating that her 13-year wait for justice had been fulfilled.

description: The European Union is unlikely to impose hefty tariffs on India and China for purchasing Russian oil, despite suggestions from the US. The EU, while aligning Russia sanctions with the US, prefers targeted measures over broad tariffs.

title: Railway Protection Force to combat stone throwing at trains with awareness drive among students
description: ‘The special awareness drive will be carried out in as many schools and colleges as possible with the support of the Government Railway Police, law enforcement agencies, educational institutions, and local administrators’

description: Preliminary report will be submitted to the District Collector, at whose direction the study is being carried out

Indian tourists, pilgrims stranded across Nepal and along Nepal-China border
description: 600 pilgrims on Kailash Mansarovar Yatra stranded in Taklakot on the Nepal-China border; tourists take refuge in hotels in Kathmandu and Pokhara as they wait for situation to ease; State governments working with External Affairs Ministry to bring back people and reassure families of their safety

title: IIPD a model movement, says Adoor Gopalakrishnan
description: The International Institute for People with Disabilities is being developed as a world-class centre for the comprehensive development of differently abled people under the Thiruvananthapuram-based Different Art Centre

Trump tariff shock: Fitch warns US economy is slowing down
description: Fitch Ratings reports a US economic slowdown, projecting a deceleration from 2.8% in 2024 to 1.6% in 2025 and 2026. Consumer spending and government expenditure are weakening, while the labor market shows signs of softening with reduced job creation. Despite tariff impacts on inflation, the Fed is expected to ease policy with rate cuts.

Asia Cup: PIL in Supreme Court against India vs Pakistan clash; seeks cancellation
description: A PIL has been filed in the Supreme Court of India seeking cancellation of the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match scheduled for September 14 in Dubai, citing national security concerns following the Pahalgam terror attack. The petitioners argue that the match undermines national dignity and disregards the sacrifices of Indian soldiers.

Asia Cup: Ruthless India crush UAE by nine wickets – Key talking points
description: India commenced their Asia Cup 2025 campaign with a dominant nine-wicket victory over the UAE. Kuldeep Yadav's mesmerizing spell of 4/7 and Shivam Dube's 3/4 dismantled UAE for a paltry 57. Abhishek Sharma's quickfire 30 and Shubman Gill's unbeaten 20 ensured a swift chase, reaching the target in just 4.3 overs.

Meet Tejasvi Manoj: Teen cybersecurity pioneer; recognised by TIME 2025
description: Inspired by her grandfather's near brush with an online scam, 16-year-old Tejasvi Manoj from Texas developed Shield Seniors. This platform educates and protects seniors from cybercrime, offering tools to identify scams and report fraud. Tejasvi, recognized as TIME's Kid of the Year 2025, aims to empower seniors to navigate the internet safely and confidently, reducing their vulnerability to financial exploitation.

World’s richest reshuffle: Ellison tops Musk; Oracle’s 41% rally drives $101bn gain
description: Larry Ellison, Oracle's co-founder, has surpassed Elon Musk to become the world's richest person in 2025. Oracle's stock soared after a record-breaking earnings report, increasing Ellison's net worth by $101 billion in a single day, reaching $393 billion. Tesla's declining share value contributed to Musk's drop to $385 billion, ending his reign at the top.

Nepal Gen Z protest: Who is Sushila Karki? Frontrunner to lead interim govt
description: Nepal's Gen Z protest movement, fueled by anger over corruption and a social media ban, has selected former Chief Justice Sushila Karki as its interim leader. Karki's neutrality and respected civic standing made her the preferred choice to represent the protesters in upcoming negotiations amidst violent unrest and curfews in Kathmandu.

title: The great patch-up: Trump tempers tariff tantrum, re-engages a willing PM Modi
description: After weeks of tension and tariff threats, the US and India are tentatively re-engaging in trade talks, spurred by concerns in Washington that a hardline approach is pushing New Delhi closer to Russia and China. Despite President Trump's outreach and PM Modi's positive response, significant disagreements remain, particularly regarding trade barriers and India's purchase of Russian oil.

title: The iPhone that Apple 'killed' after three years
description: Apple has discontinued the Plus-sized iPhone after a three-year run, replacing it with the new, slimmer, and lighter Air model priced at $999. The Plus, like the Mini before it, failed to attract enough buyers, as consumers preferred either the standard iPhone or the Pro models with enhanced features.

title: Kawhi Leonard picks Clippers: Avoids LeBron James; here's why
description: In 2019, Kawhi Leonard chose the Los Angeles Clippers over the Lakers. Reports suggest he avoided playing with LeBron James. He preferred being the main leader. Later, a controversy emerged regarding Leonard's deal with Aspiration. Allegations arose of a scheme to bypass the NBA salary cap. Steve Ballmer denied any involvement. The NBA is investigating the matter.

title: Laken Snelling case: Cheer video returns; charged in infant’s death
description: Laken Snelling, a former University of Kentucky cheerleader, was arrested after her newborn baby was found dead in her apartment closet. She faces charges including abuse of a corpse and tampering with evidence. The cause of death is undetermined, and Snelling is currently out on bond awaiting her next court hearing while the investigation continues.
